Patch

The implementation of lassign in lib/rivet/rivet-tcl/lassign.tcl has the following issues.

The lassign implementation in rivet is renamed to lassign-rivet for the following examples:
proc lassign-rivet {list args} {
    foreach elem $list varName $args {
	upvar 1 $varName var
	set var $elem
    }
}

1) May set a variable with an empty name
% lassign-rivet {1 2 3} a b
% set ""
3

2) Does not return any unused elements in list as lassign in tcl 8.5 does:
% lassign {1 2 3} a b
3

The attached patch fixes both issues.
Anyway, within TCL8.5, the rivet implementation is not used (right ?), but IMHO it is ok to be tcl8.5 compatible.
creator: harald.oehlmann@elmicron.de

Sorry, forgot the documentation.

Proposal:

Synopsys:
lassign ?value_list? ?variable? ?variable? ...

Description

lassign emulates the TclX/Tcl8.5 lassign command. It accepts a list variables and treats the rest as a list of variable names that will be assigned with the values in the caller's scope. Any unused list elements are returned.

# lassign {1 2 3 4} a b
3 4
# set a
1
# set b
2
